title: Boston Car Data Explorer
description: Won Collaborative Data Award in 2014 doing work for the Mass. D.O.T. and MAPC in the "37 Billion Mile Data Challenge". Contributed the Boston Car Data Explorer interactive data visualization tool (1920x1080 version) using D3.js, crossfilter, dc.js. Our submission was the MassVehicleExplorer.

title: Elevator Simulator (D3.js)
description: Developed distributed framework for extensive regression testing of an elevator scheduling algorithm. Created an interactive visualization of a multi-shaft, double-car scheduling algorithm using first Flash/AS3/Flex then D3.js. See it running here. The visualization revealed a "stuck lift" scenario that was fixed before release.

title: Precision Hover
description: Invented elegant precision-hover gesture capability (not available in current tablets and touchscreens) that allows touchers to precisely target single pixels on the touch display. Many user experience tasks such as this required many iterations to achieve the desired effect. This work was for the DTMouse mouse emulation utility for the DiamondTouch SDK by Circle Twelve Inc. [Video]

title: Database Development for Car HMI project
description:
Over 6 billion raw GPS and CAN-bus data items collected for an automotive HMI project (to predict and propose driver actions) required a database and extensive cleanup.
  • Architected a database including a 600-column table for feature generation. Extensive PL/pgSQL and Python coding to perform data cleansing and address out-of-memory problems (with Python, WEKA, PostgreSQL/PostGIS, and connectors). Project was completed on time and promoted as "Ultra-simple Predictive HMI" in 2014.
  • Developed algorithms for area familiarity, trip segmentation, coalescing data.
  • Developed web-based trip data visualizations to impress stakeholders and find problems (Google Earth & Maps).

title: Multi-User Multi-Touch SDK
libraries_APIs: ActiveX, Swing, D3.js, WinForms, D3.js, ActionScript3
software: Eclipse, NetBeans, Visual Studio, Flash Professional, Adobe CS (PhotoShop, Flash, Professional)
technologies: UX, dataviz, GUI, UI, OO, HMI, HCI
description:
As Chief Software Architect for a shipping commercial product, created the contents and packaging for the DiamondTouch SDK. The SDK includes application, demo and utility software with code modules for C, Java, C#/VB.NET, D3.js, Flash, JavaScript.
See all DiamondTouch product videos.

title: Power Load-Flow Algorithm Performance Visualization
software: Excel, Google Earth, Visual Studio, SVN
description: Created multi-dimensional charts and map animations to compare algorithm performance for a power load-flow analysis project. MP4 Video. Integration involved C#, JavaScript, Excel, Google Earth API.

title: DiamondTouch Immersion Distributed Architecture
description: Developed WebSockets-based distributed touch capability for video conferencing system to connect remote tables for immersive simultaneous interaction. This was for the DiamondTouch Immersion product.

title: DTCollaborate for ESRI ArcGIS
technologies: GIS, UX, GUI, HMI, HCI, UI, OO
description:
Created comprehensive ESRI ArcGIS ArcMap extension to bring simultaneous multi-user collaborative capabilities to the GIS community, including unique layer-aware interaction-history. The underlying ArcObjects object model is a part of the huge and complex ArcGIS software framework. This shipping product was for the DTCollaborate for ESRI's ArcGIS product.
Features Video

title: Decision Surface Explorer Tool
description: Tool (for Automatic Schema Matching project) to interactively explore scatterplot decision surfaces (C# Forms).

title: Optimal Route Demo
description: Transformed 250GB telematics database for use with a demo that visually compares 3 route proposal algorithms using Google Earth animations

title: DiamondTouch Immersion Remote Arms
description: Extended multi-user scribbling application to support remote users. Remote users show up as "glowing arms" as they scribble. This was for the DiamondTouch Immersion product.

title: Multi-User Multi-Touch Flash Toolkit
description:
Developed ActionScript 3 Flash toolkit for creating multi-user (DiamondTouch) games, apps, and tools with Adobe Flash.
Flick documents video.
Veggies game video.

title: Power Theft Viz
description: [Experimental] 3D visualization of power theft data.

title: Collaborative Web Browsing
description: Developed Collaborative Web Browsing (lightweight, real-time, collaborative co-browsing) shown at 2002 International WWW Conference (HTML, JavaScript, Java Servlets).

title: Metadata Visualization
description: Took over Java (Prefuse) metadata visualization tool development to meet deliverable deadline. Finished interactive GUI with emphasis on visual layouts and real-time exploration. Provided multiple linked views of the data. Each view uses a specialized layout algorithm to highlight salient points. Linking views assures that user's actions in one layout are visible in all other layouts. Layouts are interactive and dynamic to support user exploration.

title: Web Application (HTML5, jQuery, DataTables) to Process GPS data
description: Collected GPS data from volunteers for an automotive HMI project (to predict and propose driver actions). Created HTML5 web page that volunteers could use to upload, browse, and modify their GPS traces. This used HTML5 features (FileReader), jQuery, the jQuery DataTables plugin, and the Google Maps API. Developed web-based trip data visualizations to impress stakeholders and find problems (Google Earth & Maps). <a href="http://www.mitsubishielectric.com/news/2014/0210.html">Mitsubishi Electric News</s>

title: Multi-user Game
description: Multi-user game to demonstrate multiple users interacting at the same time in a game (long before touch tablets and touch screens became popular). Pivot and fire to destroy junk food without destroying healthy food. In-depth Flash development. Designed full game architecture, interactions, use of graphics/sound, etc. Video

title: Gesture exploration - flick documents
description:
Developed layout to let touch table users spin a carousel-style desktop and flick documents back and forth.
Flick-Documents Video
Gesture Engine Visualization Video

title: Multi-User Touch Mouse Emulation
description: Developed Windows mouse support via touch. This DTMouse mouse emulation utility was a critical component of the DiamondTouch SDK. It allowed touch tables to be used to drive the Windows OS and applications -- long before Windows added touch support in Windows 8. DTMouse Video

title: Driver Familiarity Algorithm and Heat Map for Car HMI project
description: Develop a numerical estimator of how familiar a driver is with the current area. This familiarity value was provided as a feature (input) to the driver prediction algorithm. Can change the customization mode of the car HMI depending on uses, e.g. commute vs. sightseeing. First familiarity estimator used the number of times a road segment had been traversed. Another familiarity estimator used the distance from previous route traces to estimate familiarity. Represented familiarity as a heat map.<ul>

title: Database Schema Matching Project (Principal/Lead Developer)
description:
Principal/lead developer for a two-year Automatic Schema Matching (ASM) project to automatically merge database schemas. Major components included the ASM framework API, object design, process modules, dozens of matchers (e.g. lexical, structure, composite), utility programs for similarity matrices aggregation (combine matcher results) and alignment extraction (choose matches from similarity matrices), and a complete Python regression system. Developed in Java and Python on Windows, then ported to Linux.
  • Succeeded in achieving ambitious 90.1% matching accuracy goal.
  • Developed a 3D scatterplot tool to interactively compare two schemas using various matchers (Java Swing/jogl/jzy3d), and another tool to interactively explore scatterplot decision surfaces (C# Forms).
  • Two-year project successfully completed on-time and was incorporated into a larger data integration platform.

title: Schema matcher similarity exploration tool
description:
Developed a 3D scatterplot tool to interactively compare two schemas using various schema matchers. User can select 2 database schemas to compare, then select from one of dozens of matching algorithms to apply. Scatterplot of elements in each schema is color-coded to show correct matches (green), incorrect matches (red), and missed matches (yellow). The height indicates the similarity value for the element pair using the currently-selected matcher. Coded using Java Swing/jogl/jzy3d.
Example matchers include PrefixNameMatcher, SynonymMatcher, TriGramDistanceMatcher, LevenshteinStringMatcher, NameMatcher, PathNameMatcher, ChildPathMatcher, SiblingMatcher, StructureMatcher, LinearCompositeMatcher.

title: Multi-user Multi-touch Map Exploration Application
description: Created a custom multi-user multi-touch map application featured in cover story of Japanese New Media magazine.

title: SOA Web Integration Project
description:
Web Integration project sponsor needed a way to programmatically interact with arbitrary websites (e.g. for ordering parts) that are designed only for mouse/keyboard interaction. Developed a Mozilla Firefox plugin as part of an SOA (Service-Oriented Architecture) Integration solution. (Experimented with SWT and Eclipse RCP; developed plugin with XUL, WSDL, RDF, ActiveX support).
  • Determined that the best solution would be a browser plugin to capture all mouse/keyboard interactions with an existing website. The plugin automatically generated an intelligent web service wrapper (WSDL/RDF), which allowed the website to be accessed entirely programmatically. Project successfully completed and delivered on time.
  • Demonstrated the final system by writing an interactive energy cost data visualization (described elsewhere).

title: Interactive energy cost data visualization
description: Demonstrated the final SOA Web Integration project (described elsewhere) by writing a multi-component data visualization that dynamically retrieved electricity cost information from an NSTAR website to create color-coded 3D bar charts of energy costs on an interactive 3D view of Massachusetts (C#, embedded web browser, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, generated KML).

title: MATLAB and Java/Swing development for Power Theft Detection project
description: Ported MATLAB algorithm code to Java for  Power Theft Detection project. Then developed Swing (JFreeChart) exploration tool and demo. Also experimented with a 3D data visualization of unusual findings (described elsewhere).

title: HTML5 jQuery DataTables application
description: Developed a web interface for optimizing schema matching results that works in conjunction with the MERL Automatic Schema Matching (ASM) framework. The tool is written with HTML5, jQuery, and the DataTables jQuery plugin. It generates an interactive table from ASM output, which can be used to perform sorting and filtering operations in conjunction with a proprietary algorithm to look for optimal matching results.

title: Multi-Touch Gestures for Controlling Synchronized Multi-Surface Map Views
description:
Created multi-surface map application to present at the ESRI International User Conference (GIS) as "Multi-Touch Gestures for Controlling Synchronized Map Views" (C#, embedded browser, KML, ArcGIS). Simultaneously synchronized views across multiple applications: ESRI ArcGIS, Google Earth, maps in web browser, and a custom application. A web service was used to synchronize the applications.
Can control a local or a remote secondary view(s). Secondary viewport is determined by:
  • Location: Mid-point of 2 touch points
  • Rotation: Angle between 2 touch points
  • Zoom: How far apart you move the two touch points
Video

title: Time Tunnel
description: Developed prototype serial image presentation technique for searching video streams. This Rapid Serial Visual Presentation technique was incorporated in the TimeShuttle feature of a high-end 73" Mitsubishi TV (Mitsubishi WD73927).
